author: Special Correspondent
text:
The AIADMK ministers on Friday took a dig at the PMK MLA’s remarks on government’s free transportation scheme for senior citizens.

Speaking on the interim budget, PMK MLA Ganesh Kumar said the AIADMK manifesto in 2011 promised free transport for all senior citizens over the age of 58, but the current scheme was a truncated one that applied only to Chennai and restricted the benefit to just 10 rides per month. While the Ministers pointed out that the announcement made on Thursday was only the first step and that it would be expanded across Tamil Nadu, Handlooms Minister Gokula Indira said the PMK had no locus standi to talk about keeping promises. “When the PMK was formed, its founder S. Ramadoss said no member of his family would enter the party . What happened to this promise,” she asked.

Responding, Mr. Ganesh Kumar said if this was taken up for discussion then he might be forced to recollect comments made in the past by former chief minister M.G. Ramachandran. “But I don’t want to go into those things,” he said.

Later, Minister for HR&CE R. Kamaraj said the PMK would forever only present “shadow budgets” and it was under Chief Minister Jayalalithaa that the next budget would be presented
title: PMK has no right to talk about keeping promises: AIADMK
